intro: Saracha diffusa, commonly known as the broadleaf spurge, is a perennial plant native to the temperate regions of Asia. It is characterized by its smooth, waxy leaves that are typically oval or lance-shaped. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. Saracha diffusa is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Its rapid growth and ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes make it a common weed in agricultural areas.
